commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I see, so that's what happened. Thank you very much. I believe I should be able to handle it.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: With this many people gathered in one place, there's no end to all the problems that arise.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Right. However, maybe this is the worst we'll have to deal with thanks to the hard work of all the volunteers.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Hehe, that's exactly right.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But I shouldn't be making you handle this with me. You don't have to deal with what goes on behind the scenes, you know?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: *Chuckle* What can I say? I just can't sit back and do nothing.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You have also been dealing with your on-stage duties as well, so you must be tired. It really is okay. Please rest until it's time for you to go back on stage.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That's the thing, I'm not tired at all. I'm baffled myself as to why I'm so full of energy!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: And I also want to see the results of my hard work with my own two eyes. Or am I imposing on you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Not at all! It helps me to have your advice from your perspective as the former student council president.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If you aren't overworking yourself then I would very much appreciate your company on my patrols.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: *Giggle* Thank you so much! I'd love to tag along!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: How does the School Idol Festival appear from your perspective?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I think it's absolutely wonderful. Everyone I pass seems to be enjoying themselves.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: And the students of Nijigasaki are at the center of the event, while the volunteers are also doing a great job.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The students are taking the initiative and thinking hard about what they're currently doing and deciding what they should prioritize next.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: But each and every student seems to really be having a lot of fun.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Indeed. This event has become the best school festival ever for Nijigasaki High School.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It delights me to see the whole school actively working to breathe life into the event and seeing everyone having fun.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I honestly didn't expect it to go this well. I regret underestimating the power of passion.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I think your level of passion is quite the force in itself...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What? You're talking about me?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes. If you weren't passionate, you wouldn't be working this hard for us, regardless of whether you made a promise or your position as the president.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I really do think you're incredible!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Wh-Why the sudden words of praise?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I'm grateful that you told me to step down as student council president.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: You saw exactly what the target of my absolute love was.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: What you said was both for the sake of the school and for me, wasn't it?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That goes to show just how passionate you are about seriously considering the happiness of others.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I have no doubt that you can lead everyone in a better direction!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Um...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I am grateful to hear you say that, and that is exactly what I strive for, but you are really giving me more praise than I deserve.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That's not true at all!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It might be a problem for me to say this now, but I believe if you continued your role as the student council president, this school would have become a wonderful place.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: After all, the running of this event has gone smoothly thanks to the creation of the app you suggested. I never would have come up with something like that.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: *Giggle* Thank you. But I still think you're more suited to the job.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Hearing you say that really does make me happy. As your successor, I will do my best to live up to your expectations.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Please do! Oh, but if anything happens, please let us lend you a hand! We'll be right at your doorstep if we need anything from you as well!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: *Chuckle* I see you have all bases covered, then.

commands.speaker: Setsuna and Shioriko
commands.line: *Giggle*

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Oh, Setsuna? Are you not due for your next appearance on stage?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Ack! I am! Thank you, Shioriko. I'll head over and get the job done!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Please do. I'll also head there to offer my support.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Ah! There you are. I finally found you. It's been a while, huh, Shioriko?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: *Gasp*

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: What's with that reaction? Don't tell me you've forgotten what your own big sister looks like?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Kaoruko, what are you doing here?

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Well, I was one of the founding members of this festival, so I obviously wanted to come check it out and see how my successors are handling it.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: And I even sent you a message last night to tell you I was coming to see you. You didn't even reply to your poor old big sister. I was almost in tears.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: But I didn't think you'd be involved in the running of the School Idol Festival itself. I thought you hated school idols?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes. I did hate them. Very much.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Right? What was it you used to say? "School idols are figures of futility," or something like that?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Well...

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: How about I take a stab at what you're thinking? I lost my smooth and secure ride to becoming the Mifune family successor because...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: ...You became too engrossed in school idols and the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Mmhmm. That's what you always thought, right?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I did.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: And so I never wanted to see anyone fail like you again.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That's why I've prioritized the aptitude of all students over anything else as the student council president. I just wanted to see everyone smile.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Yeah, I get you.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But you didn't fail. I was the one who arbitrarily decided to see it that way. I know it might be late now, but I understand what you were—

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: I understand what you're trying to say, Shioriko. I can tell just by looking around. You've got the whole school involved in this School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: It means there was something that shifted your way of thinking. Something incredibly wonderful.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes. I wasn't able to bring smiles to the faces of so many people through my own methods.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I genuinely think school idols are amazing to be capable of that.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I'm glad I learned that lesson. Now I am someone who loves school idols and supports them.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: You support school idols? *Giggle* Some things about you just never change, huh?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Never change?

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: You're drawn to the charms of school idols, yet it never occurred to you to actually want to become one?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Well... I'm more suited to working behind the scenes, and I know that's something I can do a good job at.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I'm also not good at singing or dancing. So I don't think it's the right path for me to take.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: And that's what never changes about you. You have a habit of trying to approach everything logically.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: I'm not saying that thinking logically is a bad thing, but sometimes that makes you lose sight of what's important.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Do school idols only have being good at singing and dancing going for them?

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Isn't there something more about them that strikes your heart? Isn't that why they've changed how you think? Isn't there some kind of feeling that's budded within you?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Budded? A feeling?

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: I'm sure everyone would feel at ease with you working behind the scenes, I can't deny that. And I know you'd be satisfied doing that yourself.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: But think about it, Shioriko. Isn't there an opportunity for you to do something that excites you even more?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I know you're trying to get me to admit that I want to become a school idol, but I believe that I am lacking in far too many areas.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Lacking? Are you talking about your singing and dancing abilities?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, um, how do I say this? Everyone is very serious about being a school idol.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It's not merely that they love them, but they feel some kind of belief towards them.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Ahaha! Oh, Shioriko. You're always so serious! But I like what you said just now. Belief in school idols, huh?

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: You're right. I think school idols, just like μ's, Aqours, and even the Nijigasaki girls have that certain sense of belief that you're talking about.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: And I think you have something like that, too.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Me?! No way...

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: I'm confident that no one can beat me when it comes to my love for school idols. That's why I can tell straight away when I see someone who feels the same way as me.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: If you ask me, someone who talks about having beliefs in school idols isn't merely an admirer of them.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Working on the administrative side of things isn't bad, but there are things you can't obtain unless you're a school idol yourself. That's what you're yearning for.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: At least, that's what I think.

commands.speaker: Kaoruko
commands.line: Anyway, just give it a little more thought. Think back to what you've learned from school idols.
